title: Hula Heroine Helped Preserve The Hawaiian Islands' Traditional Dance
teaser: Aloha Dalire, a master of hula, in 1971 was the first winner of Hawaii's premier competition. She died in August, but her legacy continues through hula schools she helped open in Japan and the U.S.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
